question: Which country houses the "Pacific Equatorial Forests"?
explanation: Pacific Equatorial Forests is a tropical forest ecosystem located at zero degrees latitude in coastal Ecuador. This forest hosts Tropical rainforest, moist evergreen forest, premontane cloud forest and tropical deciduous first. The Pacific Equatorial Forests, along with the rest of the coastal forest of Ecuador, is considered the most threatened tropical forest in the world and is part of the Tumbes-Choco-Magdalena biodiversity hotspot.
